title: Patchwork Uprising
outcome: Persistent BCI failures during a heatwave force neighborhoods to form grassroots cooperatives, providing power and resources to one another regardless of compliance scores. These self-managed networks prove unexpectedly effective, inspiring debates on local autonomy as some Innovators cautiously support the change, while Directorate loyalists struggle to regain central control.

events.description: A citywide heatwave causes BCI-managed energy allocations to fail, leaving low-score districts without power while high-score areas remain unaffected.
Desperate, citizens in affected districts begin sharing resources and bypassing official controls, forming neighborhood collectives that operate outside the BCI.
The effectiveness of these grassroots cooperatives gains attention; even some high-score citizens start participating, blurring previous social boundaries.
The Council debates drastic measures, with Innovators arguing local autonomy demonstrates system flaws, while Directorate members call for forceful intervention.
With the BCI sidelined, neighborhood assemblies openly discuss permanent self-governance, attracting growing numbers. Directorate crackdowns falter under widespread civilian resistance.
